title_translation.en: Bay of Bengal May Become Fishless, Researchers Express Concern
title_translation.es: **Bay of Bengal** puede quedarse sin peces, **researchers** expresan **concern**

content_translation.en: Despite success in freshwater fish production and hilsa protection, researchers are cautioning that marine fish abundance is decreasing in the Bay of Bengal and some aquatic species are becoming extinct. It is feared that if unregulated exploitation and indiscriminate harvesting are not stopped, the Bay of Bengal may become fishless in the future. Scientists are conducting this evaluation through marine fisheries research and surveys. There is no accurate estimation of fish stock in Bangladesh's sea and no limitation has been determined on how much sustainable fishing can be done. The reason was that extensive surveys and investigations had been postponed for a long time. Assessment has resumed after the procurement of a new vessel R.V. Meensandhani in 2016. This survey is conducted in the continental shelf area up to a depth of 10-200 meters in the sea. After analyzing data from the past three years, a report on marine fish has been sent to the government's higher authorities. The chief scientific officer of the Marine Fisheries Survey Management Unit of the Fisheries Directorate, Md. Sharif Uddin says, 'Our vessel-based research was completely stopped after 2000. It has been re-initiated through the Bangladesh Marine Fisheries Capacity Building project.'
content_translation.es: A pesar del √©xito en la **production** de peces de agua dulce y la **protection** del **hilsa**, los **researchers** est√°n advirtiendo que la **abundance** de peces **marine** est√° disminuyendo en el **Bay of Bengal** y algunas **aquatic species** est√°n volvi√©ndose **extinct**. Se teme que si no se detienen la **exploitation** no regulada y la **harvesting** indiscriminada, el **Bay of Bengal** puede quedarse sin peces en el futuro, tambi√©n se est√° teniendo **apprehension**. Los **scientists** est√°n realizando esta **evaluation** a trav√©s de **marine fisheries research** y **survey**. No hay **accurate estimation** del **stock** de peces en el mar de Bangladesh y no se ha determinado la **limitation** de cu√°nta **sustainable fishing** se puede hacer. La raz√≥n era que los **extensive survey** e **investigation** hab√≠an sido pospuestos durante mucho tiempo. La **assessment** se reanud√≥ despu√©s de la **procurement** del nuevo **vessel** R.V. Meensandhani en 2016. Esta **survey** se realiza en el √°rea de **continental shelf** hasta una profundidad de 10-200 metros en el mar. Despu√©s de **analysis** de datos de los √∫ltimos tres a√±os, se ha enviado un informe sobre peces marinos a las **higher authorities** del gobierno. El oficial cient√≠fico jefe de la **Marine Fisheries Survey Management Unit** del **Fisheries Directorate**, Md. Sharif Uddin dice, 'Nuestra investigaci√≥n basada en **vessel** estaba completamente detenida despu√©s de 2000. Ha sido re-**initiated** a trav√©s del **Bangladesh Marine Fisheries Capacity Building project**.'
